EmailTemplate.subject: Distribution of New Pivotal ID Badges
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi All,
We currently leverage EMC for our office access systemsâ€”essentially the ID badges and badge readers that allow us to access and gain entrance to our offices. The Dell/EMC merger, which we expect to close in the coming weeks, will require a change in these access systems and the need for everyone who has a Pivotal photo ID badge to receive a new Pivotal ID badge.
This process will start next week, August 29th.
- New Pivotal badges will be mailed to each Pivotal office, and your local concierge team will alert you when they're ready for pick-up. For offices without concierges, a designated local site administrator will receive and distribute the badges.
- Your concierge/local administrator will contact you to distribute your new Pivotal badge. If you work from a home office, your new badge will be sent to your home address.
- The new Pivotal badges will not be immediately active, so please keep and use your current badge until notified. We'll issue a memo to all of Pivotal to advise you when the new badges will become active.
- Once the new Pivotal badges are activated, you'll be asked to return your old badge to your concierge administrator.
- Again, if your current badge does not have your photo on it, no action is required.
A small fraction of Pivotal employees work out of EMC buildings and also have EMC badges. We're working with EMC to distribute to these individuals new Dell/EMC badges.
If you have any questions or concerns, please contact your manager, or open a ticket at ask@pivotal.io <[[mailto:ask@pivotal.io]]>
Robert McCormick
